title: Development of a Pediatric Obesity Management Education Module: Practical Strategies Based on the ADDIE Model

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: A practical module for childhood obesity management referencing Indian regional cases, structured around simulations of primary care physicians' roles

learning_goals: A pediatric obesity management education module can be designed by applying the five stages of the ADDIE model
Pediatric obesity diagnosis and management protocols reflecting Indian community characteristics can be explained
Educational effectiveness can be measured using Kirkpatrick Level 2 evaluation criteria
Obesity counseling skills for children can be applied to real-world scenarios through patient-doctor role-playing
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
